contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. It can be stated clearly that they were taken to Babylon. AT: "when the army of Babylon took the people of Jerusalem away as prisoners" or "when the army of Babylon took the people of Jerusalem as prisoners to Babylon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: when the people of Jerusalem were taken away as prisoners

contextId.information: This can be expressed in active form. AT: "the land where no one had sown seed" or "the land where no food was growing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the land that was not sown

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "So I withheld the spring rains from you" or "So I prevented the spring rains from falling" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: So the spring rains were withheld

contextId.information: "People hear a noise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A voice is heard

contextId.information: AT: "Circumcise yourselves to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Be circumcised to Yahweh

contextId.information: "Yahweh will say" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will be said

contextId.information: "people tell of one city after another being destroyed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Collapse after collapse is proclaimed

contextId.information: AT: "So the army of that nation will eat what you expected to harvest." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: So your harvest will be consumed

contextId.information: AT: "For I have found wicked men among my people." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For wicked men are found with my people

contextId.information: AT: "No one will gather their bones and bury them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The bones will not be gathered or buried

contextId.information: AT: "People in Dan hear the sound of the enemy army coming to attack Judah." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: The snorting of his stallions is heard from Dan

contextId.information: AT: "People are crying loudly in Jerusalem." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For the sound of wailing is heard in Zion

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will curse anyone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Cursed is anyone

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "There is a conspiracy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A conspiracy has been discovered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "but their gods will certainly not save them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: but they will certainly not be saved by them

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that my enemies were leading to a butcher" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: being led to a butcher

contextId.information: This means that Yahweh will make them feel ashamed. It does not in any way mean that he will rape them. This can be stated in active form. AT: "It is as though, I myself will strip your skirts off you, so that everyone will see your private parts and you will be ashamed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I myself will strip your skirts off you, and your private parts will be seen.

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will cause everyone to see them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I will cause them to be seen

contextId.information: AT: "I have heard your message." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Your words have been found

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "No one will mourn for them or bury them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They will not be mourned or buried

contextId.information: Here the word "they" may refer either to the people or to their actions. This can be stated in active form. AT: "they cannot hide from me" or "they cannot hide their ways from me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they cannot be hidden from before me

contextId.information: Here the word "Judah" represents the people of Judah. This may be expressed in active form. AT: "Someone has written the sin of Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The sin of Judah is written

contextId.information: AT: "I will curse any person who trusts in mankind" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The person who trusts in mankind is accursed

contextId.information: AT: "You will cut off those in the land who turn away from you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Those in the land who turn away from you will be cut off

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "people will inhabit this city forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: this city will be inhabited forever

contextId.information: AT: "fell apart in his hand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: was ruined in his hand

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You indeed deceive me" (UDB) or "you really did deceive me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I was indeed deceived

contextId.information: AT: "Curse the day I was born" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let the day when I was born be cursed

contextId.information: AT: "Curse the man who informed my father" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let the man who informed my father be cursed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I have made it possible for the ones seeking your life to capture you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I have given you to the hand of the ones seeking your life

contextId.information: AT: "then you will know that he is a true prophet of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: then it will be known that he is indeed a prophet sent out by Yahweh

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The captives of Judah will say a curse about these persons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: a curse will be spoken about these persons

contextId.information: Yahweh purposefully repeats the idea that he will build Israel to emphasize it. If your language can only use active verbs or has some other way to emphasize the idea, you may want to use it here. AT: "I will build you up again. Remember this: I will build you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: I will build you up again so you will be built

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "Cause everyone to hear your praise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let praise be heard

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "I hear a voice in Ramah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: A voice is heard in Ramah

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "They will set apart the whole valley ... for me" or "I will have them make the whole valley ... holy for me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The whole valley ... will be set apart for me

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "they were keeping Jeremiah as a prisoner" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Jeremiah the prophet was imprisoned

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "I am giving this city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: this city is being given

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the house that belongs to me" or "the building in which they worship me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the house that is called by my name

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "Then people will buy fields in this land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Then fields will be bought in this land

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) the people tore the houses down to make walls to defend against the Chaldeans AT: "that the people have torn down to defend against the siege ramps and the sword" or 2) AT: "the houses that the Chaldeans have torn down to make siege ramps so they can make war." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that are torn down because of the siege ramps and the sword

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the Babylonians will certainly seize you and give you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will certainly be seized and given

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The sons of Jonadab son of Rechab have observed their father's command to not drink wine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The words of Jonadab son of Rechab that he gave to his sons as a command, not to drink any wine, have been observed

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "Furthermore, Jeremiah and Baruch added to this scroll many more words which were similar to the words that had been in the first scroll." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Furthermore, many other similar words were added to this scroll

contextId.information: AT: "the officials put Jeremiah into a room that was under the ground" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Jeremiah was put into an underground cell

contextId.information: "I will allow the army of the king of Babylon to conquer Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: This city will be given into the hand of the army of the king of Babylon

contextId.information: AT: "I will allow the Chaldeans to conquer this city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: this city will be given into the hand of the Chaldeans

contextId.information: Here "hand" means "control" or "power." AT: "the Chaldeans may give me to the Judeans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I might be given over into their hand

contextId.information: AT: "Soldiers will bring all the women who are left ... out to the officials of the king of Babylon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: All the women who are left ... will be brought out to the officials of the king of Babylon

contextId.information: AT: "until the day that the Babylonian army captured Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: until the day Jerusalem was captured

contextId.information: AT: "That was where the Babylonian soldiers had taken Jeremiah and put him in chains" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: That was where Jeremiah had been taken to, and where he had been bound with chains

contextId.information: "those whom the enemy soldiers had not sent to Babylon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who had not been exiled to Babylon

contextId.information: "where they had fled to" or AT: "where the Babylonians had driven them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: where they had been scattered

contextId.information: "and allow the remnant of Judah to perish." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: and the remnant of Judah destroyed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom they had rescued at Gibeon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who had been rescued at Gibeon

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "where Yahweh had scattered them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: where they had been scattered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The Babylonians will take everyone captive whom I have decided must go into captivity" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Anyone who is assigned to captivity will be taken captive

contextId.information: Becoming angry and punishing people is spoken of as if fury and wrath were liquids there could be poured on people. This can be stated in active form. AT: "I became very angry and punished them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: my fury and my wrath were poured out

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you will cause me to destroy you" or "you will destroy yourselves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will be destroyed

contextId.information: Yahweh rebukes the people for not thinking about their own wicked behavior and how Yahweh punished them. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Think about what happened to you and your wives when you did evil things in the land Judah and the streets of Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Have you forgotten the evil committed by yourselves and your wives in the land of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem?

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Then we will have plenty of food" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Then we will be filled with food

contextId.information: AT: "no one will be joyful or happy in Moab now;" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: celebration and rejoicing have been taken away

contextId.information: AT: "So the enemy will destroy the people of Moab" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: So Moab will be destroyed

contextId.information: AT: "Israel is a sheep that lions scattered and drove away" Yahweh compares Israel to sheep and her enemies to lions. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Israel is a sheep scattered and driven away by lions

contextId.information: AT: "I have captured you, Babylon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: You were captured, Babylon

contextId.information: AT: "I will destroy her fighting men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: her fighting men will be destroyed

contextId.information: AT: "The Babylonians are oppressing the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The people of Israel are oppressed

contextId.information: "I will turn their pasturelands into ruined places" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Their pasturelands will be turned into ruined places

contextId.information: The news that the people listen to. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: news that is heard

contextId.information: This phrase can be changed to have an active verb. AT: "they captured her warriors." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: her warriors have been captured

contextId.information: The Babylonians broke through the wall around the city. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: was broken into
